text: Uzhhorod International Airport, (; ) is an international airport located in the city of Uzhhorod, in the western Ukrainian province of Zakarpattia. The airport is situated in the westernmost part of the city, in the Chervenytsia district at 145, Sobranetska Street. It is a small airport, serving Uzhhorod and the whole oblast. The airport's runway begins 90 meters from the Ukrainian-Slovak international border, so planes must use Slovak airspace for take-offs and landings under special treaty. From summer 2016 until March 2019, the airport did not handle regular flights. News of day: gas prices, mistakenly charged fines, airport in Uzhgorod, Ukrayinska Pravda (15 March 2019) At the end of 2018 the airport received a certificate from the European Aviation Safety Agency (EASA). On 15 March 2019 the airport resumed servicing regular flights. On 24 September 2020 Slovakia and Ukraine signed an agreement on the above mentioned special treaty.Flights to resume at Uzhgorod Airport as Ukraine, Slovakia reportedly settle border issues, UNIAN (19 August 2020) Ukraine and Slovakia sign agreement to unblock Uzhhorod airport, Ukrayinska Pravda (24 September 2020) ==Airlines and destinations== As of 3 January 2020, there are no scheduled flights out of Uzhhorod International Airport. ==Statistics== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" !
